segments.text: I see the woman treating the kitchen like her own sanctuary, blind to the mess building around her.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Thereâ€™s humor in her oblivion, yet it feels like a ticking time bomb.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: My heart sinks as I imagine what could happen if that boy falls.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The urge to protect them from their own choices is strong, but they seem so happy.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Their laughter and playful scheming make this moment feel vibrant and alive.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: How can something so innocent feel so dangerous at the same time?
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think about the careless nature of children while the adult remains blissfully unaware.
segments.speaker: PAR
